business.headline: Thumbay International Research Grant awards 14 projects at Gulf Medical UniversityThe 14 selected projects, led by top researchers from institutions like Harvard Medical School, University of Arizona, and Regensburg University, were chosen for their exceptional quality and originality.

Trump's tariffs could hurt US, but an opportunity for India: Ruchir SharmaRuchir Sharma believes India's emerging role in global trade could reshape its economic future, with a potential influx of investment as the US faces trade challenges and shifts in global capital flows.

Opting for new tax regime? Check out these 5 benefitsThe revisions introduced under the new tax regime aim to make the new regime easier, cut down on paperwork, and minimise the confusion many individuals experience in filing their returns.

Infosys Q4 results: Profit drops 12%, final dividend set at Rs 22The IT major clocked revenue of Rs 40,925 crore for the March quarter, up 8% from Rs 37,923 crore a year ago. In constant currency terms, revenue grew 4.8% YoY but declined 3.5% sequentially.

No public listing in 2 months: Where have IPOs disappeared?Just nine companies have listed on the mainboard till April this year, compared to 25 in the same period last year, and most didn't even leave a mark.
Sensex, Nifty rebound to end nearly 2% higher as banking stocks rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 1508.91 higher at 78,553.20, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 414.45 points higher at 23,851.65.
Sunscreen faceoff: Honasa vs HUL in court over ad claimsThe core of the argument is SPF, the sun protection factor which measures how well a sunscreen protects against harmful UV rays.

Flipkart ends WFH policy, asks all employees to work from office: ReportFlipkart had initially offered flexibility to employees during the pandemic. But over the past year, the company began rolling back the policy in phases—first calling senior executives back to office. Now, the mandate applies to all employees, regardless of role or function.

Vijay Kedia warns of 10 red flags to spot a potential scam amid Gensol fraudInvestor and market expert Vijay Kedia has warned that Gensol is not the only company with problems amid the findings by Sebi.

Rs 25 lakh in India or $100K in US? Bengaluru techie weighs in on what's betterChoosing to stay in India means staying close to family, celebrating festivals, and living within a culture you know well, said the tech professional.

PhonePe rolls out UPI Circle, simplifies payments for family and friendsUPI Circle is a feature by NPCI (National Payments Corporation of India) where a primary user gives permission to a secondary user to make payments from their UPI account, within set limits.

Sebi's job is to find and punish them: Tuhin Kanta Pandey on Gensol fraudThe Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) released an interim order on April 15, stating that Gensol Engineering's promoters, brothers Anmol and Puneet Singh Jaggi, had diverted company funds for personal use.

entertainment.headline: Meet Shalla-Bal: Julia Garner's Silver Surfer shines in 2025's fantastic fourJulia Garner stars as Shalla-Bal, a female Silver Surfer, in The Fantastic Four: First Steps. The 2025 reboot introduces Marvel's First Family to the MCU, with connections to future Avengers films.

The Marías announce 2025 North American tour, kicking off at CoachellaThe Marías have announced their 2025 Submarine Tour, starting at Coachella. With festival stops, new music, and support from julie and Momma, the tour promises an unforgettable indie-pop experience.

Lily Collins to begin filming Emily in Paris Season 5 in Rome in MayProduction for 'Emily in Paris' Season 5 will kick off in Rome this May, before heading back to Paris. Lily Collins' Emily will explore new romantic dynamics with returning and new cast members.

Thunderbolts IMAX tickets sell out in under an hour across US citiesMarvel fans eagerly snapped up free IMAX tickets for 'Thunderbolts' in under an hour in some major US cities. The film, featuring a team of antiheroes, premieres in India on May 1, 2025.

Gossip Girl star Michelle Trachtenberg's death linked to diabetes complicationsMichelle Trachtenberg, known for her roles in 'Buffy the Vampire Slayer' and 'Gossip Girl', has passed away. The NYC medical examiner confirmed the cause as complications from diabetes.

Fantastic Four trailer: Marvel's 1st family sets out to defend Earth from GalactusThe first trailer for 'Fantastic Four: The First Steps' introduces Marvel's First Family with a new twist. The film will arrive in theatres on July 25, 2025.

Tamannaah Bhatia to play Bipasha Basu-like role in No Entry 2: ReportActor Tamannaah Bhatia might have been approached to play one of the leads in Boney Kapoor's 'No Entry 2'. The film already features Varun Dhawan, Arjun Kapoor and Diljit Dosanjh as leads.

Asim Riaz out of Battleground after fight with Abhishek Malhan, Rubina Dilaik?Asim Riaz has reportedly been removed from the reality show Battleground following a heated altercation with co-judges Abhishek Malhan and Rubina Dilaik. The incident escalated after an initial disagreement during the shoot, leading to the cancellation of filming for the day.

L2 Empuraan OTT release: When and where to watch Mohanlal, Prithviraj filmThe highly successful Malayalam film 'L2: Empuraan', directed by Prithviraj Sukumaran and starring Mohanlal, will soon be available for streaming. The film, which faced controversy over its depiction of communal riots, will be on JioHotstar from April 24.

Kesari 2 advance booking Day 1: Akshay Kumar's film off to decent start at box officeAkshay Kumar's latest release, 'Kesari 2', seems to be starting on a decent note, and if it receives good word-of-mouth, the film has great potential to finally bring Kumar back into the big leagues at the box office.

Daredevil Born Again: Does the revival deliver, and is season two worth the wait?The revival of 'Daredevil: Born Again' brought a fresh storyline and new cast, sparking excitement among fans. As Matt Murdock's dual life unfolds, the series balanced action with deep character development.

Grimes slams beauty standards after Sephora ad interrupts podcastGrimes slams Sephora ad interruption on Apple Podcasts, calling it a "demonic AI wraith" invading her peaceful moment. The singer voiced concerns about beauty standards, AI, and their impact on young women, especially her daughter.
Rapper Badshah's rare photo with daughter Jessemy, seen yet?Rapper Badshah posted a rare picture with his daughter, Jessemy, on Instagram. Fans praised the father-daughter duo.

The Life of Chuck trailer: Tom Hiddleston to headline this Stephen King adaptationNeon has unveiled the trailer for 'The Life of Chuck', a film adaptation of Stephen King's novella. Directed by Mike Flanagan, the movie stars Tom Hiddleston and is set for a June 6 release.

Actor Lakshmi Manchu's Instagram, phone number compromised, calls it scaryLakshmi Manchu's Instagram account was hacked, prompting the actor to respond with a quirky message. She assured fans that if she needed money, she'd ask directly, adding her signature humour to the situation.

Eijaz Khan, Pavitra Punia reunite for short film after breakup. Details hereActors Eijaz Khan and Pavitra Punia have reunited for a project after their breakup. Producer Dalljiet Kaur shares insights on their collaboration.

Ben Affleck on Jon Bernthal's The Punisher: I wouldn't tangle with himBen Affleck praises Jon Bernthal's intense take on The Punisher in Daredevil: Born Again, saying he "wouldn't tangle with him." While reflecting on Marvel's evolution, Affleck shares excitement for The Accountant 2 and his admiration for the darker tone Bernthal brings to Frank Castle.

Kian's Bizarre B&B review: Bigg Boss meets backpacker hostel in this BTS' Jin showReleased-Tue Apr 08, 2025Kian's Bizarre B&B is an eccentric reality show blending quirky humour and heartwarming moments, as BTS's Jin and actor Ji Ye-eun join host Kian84 in a makeshift guesthouse. The show offers a light-hearted, less dramatic alternative to Bigg Boss, with bizarre challenges and unexpected Indian references.

Caste, cinema and uncomfortable truths: Phule's delayed release journey explainedWhy has a film about India's two revolutionary thinkers upset the self-proclaimed caretakers of the Brahmin community? Did the caste-discrimination that Savitribai Phule and Jyotiba Phule fought against not exist in India? Is the country free from caste-based prejudices today?

general news.headline: Two killed, 4 injured in shooting at Florida State University, campus on lockdownA gunman opened fire near the student union at Florida State University on Thursday, killing two and injuring at least four others, prompting a campus lockdown, chaotic evacuation scenes.

Russia denies attacking Indian pharma godown in Kyiv, blames Ukrainian missilesThe Russian embassy said that the "most likely explanation" for the fire at Indian pharma warehouse in Kyive is that "one of Ukrainian air defence missiles fell on Kusum Healthcare's warehouse setting it on fire".

Trump optimistic about 'great deal' with China after slapping 245% tariffsDespite sharp exchanges between the US and Chinese leaders recently over the tariff issue, Donald Trump expressed confidence that the two nations would "make a very good deal". He also expressed optimism about trade discussions with the European Union.

Electric acne patches look cool and are viral. But do they even work?Electric acne patches with light therapy are wearable patches that use LED light (mostly blue, red, or both) to 'kill acne-causing bacteria, reduce inflammation, and speed up healing'. Indian influencers are obsessed with them.

Virginia's Radford University on lockdown after reports of active shooter nearbyAuthorities are searching for two suspects: a Black male with dreadlocks, wearing a white and yellow shirt, and another Black male in a green long-sleeved shirt.

Knife-wielding US citizen tries to hijack flight in Belize, shot dead mid-airThe assailant wanted to be taken out of the country and demanded more fuel for the plane, reported ABC News. He was shot by a passenger on board, police said.

JEE Mains Result 2025 Live: JEE Main Session 2 - What's the latest update on results?JEE Mains Result 2025 is expected to be declared soon on the official website, but the exact timing remains uncertain. The NTA has removed the final answer key from the official website without providing any explanation.

Who is Phoenix Ikner? Florida State University gunman, son of Leon County DeputyTwo people were killed and at least five others have been hospitalised after Ikner opened fire at Florida State University. He has been taken into custody.

RCB sues Uber over viral 'Hyderabaddie' ad featuring Travis HeadRCB, in its petition before the Delhi High Court, alleged that Uber disparaged its trademark in its YouTube ad, 'Baddies in Bengaluru ft. Travis Head'.

Gangster behind 14 attacks in Punjab and wanted by NIA detained in US: SourcesPassia had claimed responsibility for an attack in which a senior police officer's vehicle exploded near the Gumtala police post in Punjab's Amritsar in January 2025.

After sudden baldness, people in this Maharashtra district now seeing nail lossIn Maharashtra's Buldhana, people who had been suffering from hair loss are now reportedly facing nail deformities.

Unable to conceive, woman fakes pregnancy, kidnaps newborn from Delhi hospitalThe accused, Pooja, escaped with the infant at around 3:17 pm, evading everyone's notice, according to the police. Her motive? She wanted to become a mother after having no luck conceiving during seven years of marriage.

Illegal occupation: India slams Pak Army's 'Kashmir our jugular vein' commentPakistan Army Chief General Asim Munir's 'won't forget it' warning on Jammu and Kashmir drew a sharp reaction from India, with New Delhi urging Pakistan to hand over the 'illegally occupied territories,' referring to Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir.

Super Parliament: Vice President's no-holds-barred attack on Supreme CourtVice President Jagdeep Dhankhar expressed alarm at the judiciary stepping into roles reserved for the Executive and Legislature.

BluSmart was a whiff of fresh air, but cleantech dirt choked itFor customers left at the mercy of last-minute ride cancellations and whimsical drivers, BluSmart was a breath of fresh air. Its courteous drivers with squeaky-clean EVs will be missed as BluSmart, ironically, falls victim to the dirt of cleantech. It has become another lesson to the Byjus chapter.

No waqf appointments, changes to waqf by user till next hearing: Supreme CourtThe Centre assured the Supreme Court that no appointments would be made to Waqf boards. The new law makes it compulsory to include non-Muslims as its members.

Rizwan has been under heavy criticism after the Pakistan's poor Champions Trophy campaign.

Don't worry, Bumrah is fine: Hardik Pandya on MI pacer's fitness in IPL 2025Mumbai Indians captain Hardik Pandya has said that there are no worries about Jasprit Bumrah's fitness ahead of the clash against Sunrisers Hyderabad. Bumrah missed the initial few games for MI this season.

After Mohamed Salah, Liverpool extend Virgil van Dijk's contract till 2027After Mohamed Salah, Liverpool have extended Virgil Van Dijk's contract at the club beyond this season. Van Dijk will remain at Liverpool until 2027 as he signed his new deal on Thursday, April 17.

Teenage shooter Suruchi Singh leads India's medal rush in Peru World Cup ISSF World Cup 2025: A day after winning the 10m air pistol gold medal, Suruchi Singh, an 18-year-old from Haryana, combined with Saurabh Chaudhary to win the 10m air pistol mixed team in Lima.

NBA: Sacramento Kings part ways with GM Monte McNair following Play-In loss to MavericksThe Sacramento Kings have officially parted ways with general manager Monte McNair. This decision comes just hours after the team's 120-106 loss to the Dallas Mavericks in the NBA Play-in tournament.

Ishan Kishan not fixated on SRH's 300-run dreamDespite Sunrisers Hyderabad's open ambition to breach the 300-run barrier, Ishan Kishan insists there's no obsession with the number. For him, the priority remains team performance over milestones or individual landmarks.

Abhishek Nayar made scapegoat? Sacking of India assistant coach shocks fansThe sacking of Abhishek Nayar, India's assistant coach, just eight months into his tenure has not gone down well with a section of fans. The former Mumbai all-rounder has become the first casualty of the BCCI's review meeting following India's disastrous Test tour of Australia.

Axar Patel relishing DC captaincy in IPL 2025: I don't go by the templateDelhi Capitals captain Axar Patel is enjoying his captaincy, especially after leading his side to the top of the IPL 2025 points table following a thrilling Super Over victory over Rajasthan Royals at the Arun Jaitley Stadium.

Jess Jonassen left out, Flintoff earns maiden Cricket Australia women's contractCricket Australia (CA) has unveiled its new 18-player women's national contract list for the 2025-26 season. Veteran all-rounder Jess Jonassen has been left out of the updated list.

NBA Play-in tournament: Heat dominate Bulls while Mavericks edge out KingsThe Dallas Mavericks and the Miami Heat kept their chances alive for the playoffs after winning their respective games on Wednesday night, April 16.

Hardik, Pollard have helped me stay calm under pressure: Naman DhirIPL 2025, MI vs SRH: In the pre-match press conference, Naman Dhir said that Hardik Pandya and Kieron Pollard have helped him learn the art of staying calm under pressure while batting at No.6 and 7.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
